remarks: The composition of a continuous function with a measurable function is measurable.  (More generally, ` G ` can be a Borel-measurable function, but notably the condition that ` G ` be only measurable is too weak, the usual counterexample taking ` G ` to be the Cantor function and ` F ` the indicator function of the ` G ` -image of a nonmeasurable set, which is a subset of the Cantor set and hence null and measurable.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2014.)
statement: cncombf $p |- ( ( F e. MblFn /\ F : A --> B /\ G e. ( B -cn-> CC ) ) -> ( G o. F ) e. MblFn ) $.
